SEARCH
Package bn.base

Class CPT

java.lang.Object
bn.base.CPT
All Implemented Interfaces:
CPT
public class CPT extends Object implements CPT
Base implementation of a conditional probability table (CPT) as a Map from Assignments to Distributions.

Per AIMA, for finite, discrete distributions, we use a table with one row for every combination of Values for the parents (an ArrayMapAssignment), and a column for each Value of the CPT's variable (a Distribution).

CPTs are also used to store prior Distributions for variables with no parents. In that case there is one entry in the map, with an empty ArrayMapAssignment, and probabilities for each of the variable's Values.

    • getRowForAssignment

      protected Distribution getRowForAssignment(Assignment a)
      Return the ``row'' (Distribution) for the given ArrayMapAssignment in this CPT. We can't just use the assignment as the key to find the row, since it may contain entries for other variables besides just our parents. Using ArrayMaps for Assignments, the entrySet has to be created from the underlying ArrayList. The default implementation in AbstractSet is probably expensive, making this expensive. Sigh.

    • addRowForAssignment

      protected Distribution addRowForAssignment(Assignment a)
      Add a ``row'' (Distribution) for the given ArrayMapAssignment to this CPT.

    • get

      public double get(Value value, Assignment assignment) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Return the probability of the given Value for this CPT's RandomVariable, given the values of its parents in the given ArrayMapAssignment. Note that the assignment may contain values for variables other than this CPT's variable (but it must contain at least values for the parents or an error will occur). Throws IllegalArgumentException if there is no entry for the given ArrayMapAssignment and Value in this CPT.
      Specified by:
      get in interface CPT
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • copy

      public CPT copy()
      Return a copy of this CPT for the same RandomVariable as this one, referencing the same Assignments (and hence their RandomVariables and Values), but with copies of the Distributions so that the probabilities can be changed without changing this CPT.
      Specified by:
      copy in interface CPT
